AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: US Court of Appeals circuit reviewing the case regarding roving border patrol stops and the Brignoni-Ponce standard
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical reference point relevant for roving border patrol stops and the Brignoni-Ponce test, approximately 115 miles south of the stop in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where the incident took place, with northbound lanes, leading directly to the United States-Mexican border and passing through Laredo, Texas, known as a common smuggling route with a history of alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: location where Maria De Jesus Garcia was stopped, approximately 115 miles north of the United States-Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the legal case is taking place, with a Constitution that protects residents from unreasonable searches and seizures
